extendedIngredients.name: italian seasoned bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs

extendedIngredients.name: mayonnaise
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup mayonnaise (I used Whipped Salad Dressing)

recipes.title: Simple Italian Baked Chicken Breast

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken Breast. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220 C)in a medium size bowl mix together the mayo, Parmesan Cheese, Garlic Powder. Place the seasoned bread crumbs in a separate bowl. (I used a pie dish- the size seems to work well for coating)Dip the chicken in the mayo mixture, then roll in the bread crumbs to coat.Bake in the oven for 20 minutes, until golden brown and the juices run clear. Internal temperature should be 165.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425F (220 C)in a medium size bowl mix together the mayo, Parmesan Cheese, Garlic Powder.
Place the seasoned bread crumbs in a separate bowl. (I used a pie dish- the size seems to work well for coating)Dip the chicken in the mayo mixture, then roll in the bread crumbs to coat.
Bake in the oven for 20 minutes, until golden brown and the juices run clear. Internal temperature should be 165.
